channel.title: Good Coders Look In Here Please!
channel.description:
:( K so i downloaded a source and im now currently hosting it im trying to code some stuff in and im struggling with the servermessages that appear when you log in... i went into client.java and found them i changed just the text saved the file restarted server. Yet the messages remain the same stating that someone else is the owner and other random shit... How can i fix this :(?
Ty for reading

item.title: Good Coders Look In Here Please!
item.dc:creator: @opperrangepk opperrangepk
item.description:

My server messages of my source wher at my Player.java file i changed it and compiled it and it worked maybe you should chek that

Read full topic
item.source: Good Coders Look In Here Please!

item.title: Good Coders Look In Here Please!
item.dc:creator: @b15 b15
item.description:
@b15 wrote:

here try this. it makes u click any key each line so u can read error before it closes, then after u get error post on here so we can help


@echo off
if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error)
pause
:compile
pause
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
pause
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
pause
if defined p (goto end)
pause
:error
pause
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
"%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
pause
echo Finished!
pause
exit

this is to put in compiler.bat (its just to show you error with out closing right away)

Read full topic
item.source: Good Coders Look In Here Please!

item.description:
@frozon566 wrote:

right clik ure compiler and click edit and delete everything in it then put this in it

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

then save and close it and try running it.

item.title: Good Coders Look In Here Please!
item.dc:creator: @suppyscape suppyscape
item.description:
@suppyscape wrote:

in the class path change the “jdk1.5.0” to the JDK version you have
in the PATH change the “jre6” to the jre version you have.

you can find those in My computer>Hard Drive>Program Files>Java

Read full topic
item.source: Good Coders Look In Here Please!

item.dc:creator: @gf_you_tried gf you tried

item.source: Good Coders Look In Here Please!

item.title: Good Coders Look In Here Please!
item.dc:creator: @suppyscape suppyscape
item.description:
@suppyscape wrote:

its your classpath and path files. open start and find my computer and right click it. Then click properties. Advanced>Environmental Properties. find Classpath or CLASSPATH and edit it:

;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0\bin;.

then find PATH or path then edit it and put this in: C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin

P.S if you don’t have either of those files then make them.

Read full topic

item.title: Good Coders Look In Here Please!
item.dc:creator: @suppyscape suppyscape
item.description:
@suppyscape wrote:

Download the latest version of JDK here: java.sun.com/javase/downloads

then put this in compile.bat

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

Read full topic
